column1: n the case of, Ratnasiri and others v. Ellawala and others, (2004) SLR 180 12, it was held

"This  court 
is  mindful  of  the  fact  that  the  prerogative  remedies 
it 
is
empowered to grant in these proceedings are not available as of right. Court

has  a  discretion 
in  regard  to  the  grant  of  relief 
in  the  exercise  of 
its
supervisory jurisdiction. It has been held time and time again by our Courts
that "A writ... will not issue where it would be vexatious or futile. "
